item.title: Who is best: Finance, Supply or Sales?
item.description: Which is the best department to oversee Demand Planning: Sales, Supply or Finance? This question, often asked, lends itself to my experience of at least 2 years under each of these departments within FMCG businesses. Finance from 2006 to 2008 Supply from 2008 to 2011 Sales from 2011 to 2015 This blog post, mixing my own observations with my own opinions, covers the following areas: The role of demand planning Impressions while under Finance, Supply and Sales Which department should oversee demand planning A key consideration to appointing a demand manager The final word - Sales Demand Planning’s role

item.title: The Agile opportunity for Demand Planning Improvements
item.description: Demand planning team “going OK / not going OK”! A demand planner was recounting how her team was travelling OK but she felt that there was scope for significant improvement. For one thing, she felt that her team’s stakeholders didn’t really understand what the team did “beneath the bonnet” and would struggle to explain what value that they added to the business. There was, certainly, general satisfaction in the team’s output and people would say that, from the outside, that they were working well together, but that also reflected that stakeholders were somewhat unaware of the internal machinations.
